result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L Held was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
No credit if revoked from probation.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Testify truthfully in all court appearances. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

*AODA or MN equivalent, such as Rule 25 or Chemical Dependency Evaluation, completed within 6 months of plea. 
Defendant is currently participating in: HCMC- Addiction Medicine Clinic and Hennepin County - Project Child. Compliance and follow through in these programs is sufficient to meet this condition.

No contact with co defendant Marcus Newgard 
No contact with co defendant Brandon Martin, while Eau Claire County Cases 22CF749 and 22CF750 are pending. Contact after cases has been resolved is at the discretion of the probation agent. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica L Held

records.addlTxt:
11:05 AM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Jessica L Held appeared by video without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives reading of Information. 
There is an agreement which the State recites. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Defendant advised of right to an attorney and Court finds the defendant has waived their right to an attorney freely and voluntarily. 
Court has a colloquy with the defendant regarding pleading to a felony without an attorney. 
Defendant enters a Guilty plea to count 1 of the Information. 
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Attorney Kirkpatrick makes a statement before sentencing. 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. Court addresses the defendant before sentencing. 

Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Testify truthfully in all court appearances. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No Contact with co defendant M.N.
No contact with co- defendant B.M. while Eau Claire cases 22CF749, 22CF750. The no contact with B.M. can be lifted at the discretion of the Probation agent after the pending cases are resolved. 
Complete AODA or MN equivalent, such as Rule 25 or Chemical Dependency Evaluation, completed within 6 months of plea.
Continue to comply with HCMC - Addiction Medicine Clinic and Hennepin County - Project Child compliance. Compliance with these are sufficient alternatives to AODA. 
Pay court costs including the DNA sample surcharge. 
There is no credit if revoked from Probation.

10:32 AM Defendant Jessica L Held appeared by video without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant would like to accept the agreement. The agreement involves a felony plea. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. This case is referred to Judge Barna for scheduling an arraignment/plea hearing.

Conditions:  
No contact with co-defendant M.N., co-defendant B.M.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:45 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jessica L Held in court without counsel.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 29, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:  
No contact with co-defendant M.N., co-defendant B.M.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
